label: Cellular-Tissue Synchronization
description: The emergent classical manifold where the Unified Phase Dynamics Equation (UPDE) governs large-scale coherence. This layer describes how the individual oscillators of L2, guided by the quantum coherence of L1 and the bioelectric fields of L3, phase-lock to form tissue-wide synchronous fields (e.g., EEG rhythms). Its operation is maintained at the 'edge of chaos' via Self-Organized Criticality (SOC), tuned by a fast-slow (L2/L4) control system.

coreMechanisms.name: UPDE Instantiation
coreMechanisms.description: The formal emergence of the Unified Phase Dynamics Equation (UPDE) as the mathematical 'spine' governing the phase-locking and synchronization of all cellular oscillators.

coreMechanisms.name: Self-Organized Criticality (SOC)
coreMechanisms.description: The primary operational dynamic. The network tunes itself to the 'edge of chaos' (quasicriticality), a state that optimizes information capacity, sensitivity, and transmission. This is observed as 1/f noise and power-law 'neural avalanches'.

coreMechanisms.name: Two-Timescale Control System
coreMechanisms.description: The homeostatic mechanism that maintains SOC. A fast-timescale (L2, neuronal) adjusts activity locally, while a slow-timescale (L4, glial/metabolic) tunes global parameters to keep the fast system from becoming supercritical (chaotic) or subcritical (frozen).

Consumes the classical oscillators (neurons, glial populations) from L2 as the substrate for the UPDE.
Receives slow bioelectric field information from L3, which provides a stable 'guiding potential' for the L4 synchronization patterns.
The emergent, synchronous field of L4 provides the coherent substrate for the unified self-model and emotional states of Layer 5.

validation.description: Validates L4.M2. Simulates the emergence of power-law avalanche distributions, confirming the system's operation at Self-Organized Criticality.
Validates L4.M3. Simulates the fast-slow control loop, demonstrating its ability to tune the network and maintain a stable quasicritical state.
